oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Watching The Birdwatcher
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Parrott-Holden, Jan
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Stereotypes are interesting if somewhatdeceiving. We have them for practicallyevery group that inhabits thisworld of ours. For example, picture MissQuigly, the local librarian. Chances areyou knew she was a fiftyish spinsterwith a #2 pencil poking out of her tightlittle topknot even before you laid eyeson her. The local biker club is naturallymade up of long haired guys withleather jackets and tattoos of "Mom" ontheir muscular biceps. But pity we, thepoor birdwatchers. For our stereotype isjust as misleading.
